Utah Code Annotated - Title 4 - Chapter 41a - Cannabis Production Establishments and Pharmacies
***********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Cannabis Production Establishments."

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1): "Adulterant" means any poisonous or deleterious substance in a quantity that may be injurious to health, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(a): pesticides;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(b): heavy metals;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(c): solvents;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(d): microbial life;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(e): artificially derived cannabinoid;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(f): toxins; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(1)(g): foreign matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(2): "Advertise" or "advertising" means information provided by a person in any medium:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(2)(a): to the public; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(2)(b): that is not age restricted to an individual who is at least 21 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(3): 26B-1-435 "Advisory board" means the Medical Cannabis Policy Advisory Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4): 76-10-3103
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(a): 76-10-3103 "Anticompetitive business practice" means any practice that reduces the amount of competition in the medical cannabis market that would be considered an attempt to monopolize, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b): "Anticompetitive business practice" may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(i): agreements that may be considered unreasonable when competitors interact to the extent that they are:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(i)(A): no longer acting independently; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(i)(B): when collaborating are able to wield market power together;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(ii): monopolizing or attempting to monopolize trade by:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(ii)(A): acting to maintain or acquire a dominant position in the market; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(ii)(B): preventing new entry into the market; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(4)(b)(iii): other conduct outlined in rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(5)(a): "Artificially derived cannabinoid" means a chemical substance that is created by a chemical reaction that changes the molecular structure of any chemical substance derived from the cannabis plant.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(5)(b): "Artificially derived cannabinoid" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(5)(b)(i): a naturally occurring chemical substance that is separated from the cannabis plant by a chemical or mechanical extraction process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(5)(b)(ii): a cannabinoid that is produced by decarboxylation from a naturally occurring cannabinoid acid without the use of a chemical catalyst.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(6): 26B-1-420 "Cannabis Research Review Board" means the Cannabis Research Review Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(7): 26B-4-201 "Cannabis" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(8): "Cannabis concentrate" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(8)(a): the product of any chemical or physical process applied to naturally occurring biomass that concentrates or isolates the cannabinoids contained in the biomass; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(8)(b): any amount of a natural cannabinoid or artificially derived cannabinoid in an artificially derived cannabinoid's purified state.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(9): "Cannabis cultivation byproduct" means any portion of a cannabis plant that is not intended to be sold as a cannabis plant product.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(10): "Cannabis cultivation facility" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(10)(a): possesses cannabis;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(10)(b): grows or intends to grow cannabis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(10)(c): sells or intends to sell cannabis to a cannabis cultivation facility, a cannabis processing facility, or a medical cannabis research licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(11): "Cannabis cultivation facility agent" means an individual who
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(12): "Cannabis derivative product" means a product made using cannabis concentrate.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(13): "Cannabis plant product" means any portion of a cannabis plant intended to be sold in a form that is recognizable as a portion of a cannabis plant.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(14): "Cannabis processing facility" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(14)(a): acquires or intends to acquire cannabis from a cannabis production establishment;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(14)(b): possesses cannabis with the intent to manufacture a cannabis product;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(14)(c): manufactures or intends to manufacture a cannabis product from unprocessed cannabis or a cannabis extract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(14)(d): sells or intends to sell a cannabis product to a medical cannabis pharmacy or a medical cannabis research licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(15): "Cannabis processing facility agent" means an individual who
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(16): 26B-4-201 "Cannabis product" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(17): "Cannabis production establishment" means a cannabis cultivation facility, a cannabis processing facility, or an independent cannabis testing laboratory.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(18): "Cannabis production establishment agent" means a cannabis cultivation facility agent, a cannabis processing facility agent, or an independent cannabis testing laboratory agent.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(20): "Closed-door medical cannabis pharmacy" means a facility operated by a home delivery medical cannabis pharmacy for delivering cannabis or a medical cannabis product.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(21): "Community location" means a public or private elementary or secondary school, a church, a public library, a public playground, or a public park.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-102(22): "Cultivation space" means, quantified in square feet, the horizontal area in which a cannabis cultivation facility cultivates cannabis, including each level of horizontal area if the cannabis cultivation facility hangs, suspends, stacks, or otherwise positions plants above other plants in multiple levels.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103 Inventory control system.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(1): Each cannabis production establishment and each medical cannabis pharmacy shall maintain an inventory control system that meets the requirements of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2): 26B-4-202 A cannabis production establishment and a medical cannabis pharmacy shall ensure that the inventory control system maintained by the establishment or pharmacy:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(a): tracks cannabis using a unique identifier, in real time, from the point that a cannabis plant is eight inches tall and has a root ball until the cannabis is disposed of or sold, in the form of unprocessed cannabis or a cannabis product, to an individual with a medical cannabis card;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(b): maintains in real time a record of the amount of cannabis and cannabis products in the possession of the establishment or pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(c): includes a video recording system that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(c)(i): tracks all handling and processing of cannabis or a cannabis product in the establishment or pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(c)(ii): is tamper proof; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(c)(iii): stores a video record for at least 45 days; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(2)(d): 26B-4-202 preserves compatibility with the state electronic verification system described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(3): (6) A cannabis production establishment and a medical cannabis pharmacy shall allow the following to access the cannabis production establishment's or the medical cannabis pharmacy's inventory control system at any time:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(3)(a): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(3)(b): the Department of Health and Human Services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(3)(c): (6) a financial institution that the Division of Finance validates, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The department may establish compatibility standards for an inventory control system by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(5)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The department shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-103(5)(b): (5)(a) The department shall ensure that the rules described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104 Qualified Production Enterprise Fund -- Creation -- Revenue neutrality.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104(1): There is created an enterprise fund known as the "Qualified Production Enterprise Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104(2): (3) The fund created in this section is funded from:

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104(2)(c): (3) the interest described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104(3): Interest earned on the Qualified Production Enterprise Fund shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104(4): The department may only use money in the fund to fund the department's implementation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-104(5): The department shall set fees authorized under this chapter in amounts that the department anticipates are necessary, in total, to cover the department's cost to implement this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-106 Severability clause.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-106(1): If a final decision of a court of competent jurisdiction holds invalid any provision of this title or Laws of Utah 2018, Third Special Session, Chapter 1 or the application of any provision of this title or Laws of Utah 2018, Third Special Session, Chapter 1 to any person or circumstance, the remaining provisions of this title and Laws of Utah 2018, Third Special Session, Chapter 1 remain effective without the invalidated provision or application.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-106(2): The provisions of this title and Laws of Utah 2018, Third Special Session, Chapter 1 are severable.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108 Payment provider for electronic medical cannabis transactions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(1): A cannabis production establishment, a medical cannabis pharmacy, or a prospective home delivery medical cannabis pharmacy seeking to use a payment provider shall submit to the Division of Finance and the state treasurer information regarding the payment provider the prospective licensee will use to conduct financial transactions related to medical cannabis, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(1)(a): the name and contact information of the payment provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(1)(b): the nature of the relationship between the establishment, pharmacy, or prospective pharmacy and the payment provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(1)(c): for a prospective home delivery medical cannabis pharmacy, the processes the prospective licensee and the payment provider have in place to safely and reliably conduct financial transactions for medical cannabis shipments.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1); (2)(a) The Division of Finance shall, in consultation with the state treasurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(2)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(2)(b): (1) review submissions the Division of Finance and the state treasurer receive under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(2)(c): (2)(a) approve a payment provider that meets the standards described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(2)(d): establish a list of approved payment providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(3): Any licensed cannabis production establishment, licensed medical cannabis pharmacy, or medical cannabis courier may use a payment provider that the Division of Finance approves, in consultation with the state treasurer, to conduct transactions related to the establishment's, pharmacy's, or courier's respective medical cannabis business.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-108(4): If Congress passes legislation that allows a cannabis-related business to facilitate payments through or deposit funds in a financial institution, a cannabis production establishment or a medical cannabis pharmacy may facilitate payments through or deposit funds in a financial institution in addition to or instead of a payment provider that the Division of Finance approves, in consultation with the state treasurer, under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109 Advertising.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(1): Except as provided in this chapter, a person may not advertise regarding the recommendation, sale, dispensing, or transportation of medical cannabis, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(1)(a): a promotional discount or incentive;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(1)(b): a particular medical cannabis product, medical cannabis device, medical cannabis brand, or medicinal dosage form; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(1)(c): an assurance of a medical outcome related to a medical cannabis treatment.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(2)(a): a nonprofit organization that offers financial assistance for medical cannabis treatment to low-income patients may advertise the organization's assistance if the advertisement does not relate to a specific medical cannabis pharmacy or a specific medical cannabis product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(2)(b): a medical cannabis pharmacy may provide information regarding subsidies for the cost of medical cannabis treatment to patients who affirmatively accept receipt of the subsidy information.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3): To ensure that the name and logo of a licensee under this chapter have a medical rather than a recreational disposition, the name and logo of the licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(a): may include terms and images associated with:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(a)(i): a medical disposition, including "medical," "medicinal," "medicine," "pharmacy," "apothecary," "wellness," "therapeutic," "health," "care," "cannabis," "clinic," "compassionate," "relief," "treatment," and "patient;" or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(a)(ii): the plant form of cannabis, including "leaf," "flower," and "bloom;" and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(b): may not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(b)(i): any term, statement, design representation, picture, or illustration that is associated with a recreational disposition or that appeals to children;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(b)(ii): an emphasis on a psychoactive ingredient;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(b)(iii): a specific cannabis strain; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(3)(b)(iv): terms related to recreational marijuana, including "weed," "pot," "reefer," "grass," "hash," "ganga," "Mary Jane," "high," "buzz," "haze," "stoned," "joint," "bud," "smoke," "euphoria," "dank," "doobie," "kush," "frost," "cookies," "rec," "bake," "blunt," "combust," "bong," "budtender," "dab," "blaze," "toke," or "420."
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-109(4): (3) The department shall define standards for advertising authorized under this chapter, including names and logos in accordance with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201(2)(c)(i): A person may not locate a cannabis production establishment:

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1 Cannabis Production Establishment and Pharmacy Licensing Advisory Board -- Composition -- Duties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(1): There is created within the department the Cannabis Production Establishment and Pharmacy Licensing Advisory Board.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(2): The commissioner shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(2)(a): appoint the members of the board;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(2)(b): submit the name of each individual that the commissioner appoints under Subsection (2)(a) to the governor for confirmation or rejection; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(2)(c): if the governor rejects an appointee that the commissioner submits under Subsection (2)(b), appoint another individual in accordance with this Subsection (2).
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (3)(c), the board shall consist of the following eight members:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i): the following seven voting members whom the commissioner appoints:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(A): one member of the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(B): one member with knowledge and experience in the pharmaceutical or nutraceutical manufacturing industry;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(C): one member representing law enforcement;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(D): one member whom an organization representing medical cannabis patients recommends;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(E): a chemist who has experience with cannabis and who is associated with a research university;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(F): a pharmacist who is not associated with the medical cannabis industry; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(i)(G): an accountant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(a)(ii): the commissioner or the commissioner's designee as a non-voting member, except to cast a deciding vote in the event of a tie.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(b): The commissioner may appoint a ninth member to the board who has a background in the cannabis cultivation and processing industry.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(c): The commissioner or the commissioner's designee shall serve as the chair of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(d): An individual is not eligible for appointment to be a member of the board if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(d)(i): has any commercial or ownership interest in a cannabis production establishment, medical cannabis pharmacy, or medical cannabis courier;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(d)(ii): has an owner, officer, director, or employee whose family member holds a license or has an ownership interest in a cannabis production establishment, medical cannabis pharmacy, or medical cannabis courier; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(3)(d)(iii): is employed or contracted to lobby on behalf of any cannabis production establishment, medical cannabis pharmacy, or medical cannabis courier.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (4)(b), a voting board member shall serve a term of four years, beginning July 1 and ending June 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(b): Notwithstanding Subsection (4)(a), for the initial appointments to the board, the commissioner shall stagger the length of the terms of board members to ensure that the commissioner appoints two or three board members every two years.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(c): As a board member's term expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(c)(i): the board member is eligible for reappointment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(c)(ii): the commissioner shall make an appointment, in accordance with Subsection (2), for the new term before the end of the member's term.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(d): When a vacancy occurs on the board for any reason other than the expiration of a board member's term, the commissioner shall appoint a replacement to the vacant position, in accordance with Subsection (2), for the unexpired term.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(e): In making appointments, the commissioner shall ensure that no two members of the board are employed by or represent the same company or nonprofit organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(4)(f): The commissioner may remove a board member for cause, neglect of duty, inefficiency, or malfeasance.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(5): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(5)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(5)(a)(i): Five members of the board constitute a quorum of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-201.1(5)(a)(ii): An action of the majority of the board members when a quorum is present constitutes an action of the board.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401 Cannabis production establishment -- General operating requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1): 4-41a-201; 4-41a-204
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(a): 4-41a-201; 4-41a-204 A cannabis production establishment shall operate in accordance with the operating plan described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(b): A cannabis production establishment shall notify the department before a change in the cannabis production establishment's operating plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c)(i): If a cannabis production establishment changes the cannabis production establishment's operating plan, the establishment shall ensure that the new operating plan complies with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c)(ii): The department shall establish by rule, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, a process to:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c)(ii)(A): review a change notification described in Subsection (1)(b);
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c)(ii)(B): identify for the cannabis production establishment each point of noncompliance between the new operating plan and this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c)(ii)(C): provide an opportunity for the cannabis production establishment to address each identified point of noncompliance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(1)(c)(ii)(D): suspend or revoke a license if the cannabis production establishment fails to cure the noncompliance.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(2): 4-41a-301; 4-41a-201 A cannabis production establishment shall operate:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(2)(a): 4-41a-301 except as provided in Subsection (5), in a facility that is accessible only by an individual with a valid cannabis production establishment agent registration card issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(2)(b): 4-41a-201 at the physical address provided to the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(3): A cannabis production establishment may not employ an individual who is younger than 21 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(4): A cannabis production establishment may not employ an individual who has been convicted, under state or federal law, of:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(4)(a): a felony in the preceding 10 years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(4)(b): after December 3, 2018, a misdemeanor for drug distribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(5): A cannabis production establishment may authorize an individual who is at least 18 years old and is not a cannabis production establishment agent to access the cannabis production establishment if the cannabis production establishment:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(5)(a): tracks and monitors the individual at all times while the individual is at the cannabis production establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(5)(b): maintains a record of the individual's access, including arrival and departure.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(6): A cannabis production establishment shall operate in a facility that has:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(6)(a): a single, secure public entrance;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(6)(b): a security system with a backup power source that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(6)(b)(i): detects and records entry into the cannabis production establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(6)(b)(ii): provides notice of an unauthorized entry to law enforcement when the cannabis production establishment is closed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-401(6)(c): a lock or equivalent restrictive security feature on any area where the cannabis production establishment stores cannabis or a cannabis product.


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402 Inspections.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(1): The department may inspect the records and facility of a cannabis production establishment at any time during business hours to determine if the cannabis production establishment complies with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2): 4-41a-404; (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(a): An inspection under this section may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(a)(i): inspection of a site, facility, vehicle, book, record, paper, document, data, and other physical or electronic information;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(a)(ii): questioning of any relevant individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(a)(iii): observation of an independent cannabis testing laboratory's methods, standards, practices, and procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(a)(iv): the taking of a specimen of cannabis or cannabis products sufficient for testing purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(a)(v): inspection of equipment, an instrument, a tool, or machinery, including a container or label.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(2)(b): 4-41a-404; (2)(a) Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(3): In making an inspection under this section, the department may freely access any area and review and make copies of a book, record, paper, document, data, or other physical or electronic information, including financial data, sales data, shipping data, pricing data, and employee data.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Failure to provide the department or the department's authorized agents immediate access to records and facilities during business hours in accordance with this section may result in:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(4)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act the imposition of a civil monetary penalty that the department sets in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(4)(b): license or registration suspension or revocation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-402(4)(c): an immediate cessation of operations under a cease and desist order that the department issues.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405 Excess and disposal.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(1): As used in this section, "medical cannabis waste" means waste and unused material from the cultivation and production of medical cannabis.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2): Title 19, Chapter 6, Part 5, Solid Waste Management Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A cannabis production establishment shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2)(a): render medical cannabis waste unusable and unrecognizable before transporting the medical cannabis waste from the cannabis production establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2)(b): Title 19, Chapter 6, Part 5, Solid Waste Management Act; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act dispose of medical cannabis waste in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2)(b)(i): federal and state laws, rules, and regulations related to hazardous waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2)(b)(ii): the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 6991 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2)(b)(iii): Title 19, Chapter 6, Part 5, Solid Waste Management Act
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(2)(b)(iv): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act other regulations that the department makes in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-405(3): An individual may not transport or dispose of medical cannabis waste other than as provided in this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501 Cannabis cultivation facility -- Operating requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(1): A cannabis cultivation facility shall ensure that any cannabis growing at the cannabis cultivation facility is not visible from the ground level of the cannabis cultivation facility perimeter.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(2): A cannabis cultivation facility shall use a unique identifier that is connected to the facility's inventory control system to identify:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(2)(a): beginning at the time a cannabis plant is eight inches tall and has a root ball, each cannabis plant;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(2)(b): each unique harvest of cannabis plants;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(2)(c): each batch of cannabis the facility transfers to a medical cannabis pharmacy, a cannabis processing facility, or an independent cannabis testing laboratory; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(2)(d): any excess, contaminated, or deteriorated cannabis of which the cannabis cultivation facility disposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(3): A cannabis cultivation facility shall identify cannabis biomass as cannabis byproduct or cannabis plant product before transferring the cannabis biomass from the facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(4): 4-41a-405 A cannabis cultivation facility shall either:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(4)(a): ensure that a cannabis processing facility chemically or physically processes cannabis cultivation byproduct to produce a cannabis concentrate for incorporation into cannabis derivative products; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-501(4)(b): 4-41a-405 destroy cannabis cultivation byproduct in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502 Cannabis -- Labeling and child-resistant packaging.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502(1): For any cannabis that a cannabis cultivation facility cultivates or otherwise produces and subsequently ships to another cannabis production establishment, the facility shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502(1)(a): label the cannabis with a label that has a unique batch identification number that is connected to the inventory control system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502(1)(b): package the cannabis in a container that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502(1)(b)(i): tamper evident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502(1)(b)(ii): not appealing to children.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-502(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(b)(ii) The department may make rules, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-601 Cannabis processing facility -- Operating requirements -- General.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A cannabis processing facility shall ensure that a cannabis product the cannabis processing facility sells complies with the requirements of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602 Cannabis product -- Labeling and child-resistant packaging.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1): 4-41a-701 For any cannabis product that a cannabis processing facility processes or produces and for any raw cannabis that the facility packages, the facility shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a): 4-41a-701 label the cannabis or cannabis product with a label that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(i): clearly and unambiguously states that the cannabis product or package contains cannabis;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(ii): 4-41a-701 clearly displays the amount of total composite tetrahydrocannabinol, cannabidiol, and any known cannabinoid that is greater than 1% of the total cannabinoids contained in the cannabis or cannabis product as determined under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(iii): has a unique identification number that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(iii)(A): is connected to the inventory control system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(iii)(B): identifies the unique cannabis product manufacturing process the cannabis processing facility used to manufacture the cannabis product;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(iv): identifies the cannabinoid extraction process that the cannabis processing facility used to create the cannabis product;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(v): does not display an image, word, or phrase that the facility knows or should know appeals to children; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(a)(vi): discloses each active or potentially active ingredient, in order of prominence, and possible allergen; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b): package the raw cannabis or cannabis product in a medicinal dosage form in a container that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(i): is tamper evident and tamper resistant;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(ii): does not appeal to children;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(iii): does not mimic a candy container;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(iv): complies with child-resistant effectiveness standards that the United States Consumer Product Safety Commission establishes;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(v): includes a warning label that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(v)(A): for a container labeled before July 1, 2021, "WARNING: Cannabis has intoxicating effects and may be addictive. Do not operate a vehicle or machinery under its influence. KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN. This product is for medical use only. Use only as directed by a qualified medical provider.";
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(v)(B): for a container labeled on or after July 1, 2021, "WARNING: Cannabis has intoxicating effects and may be addictive. Do not operate a vehicle or machinery under its influence. KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN. This product is for medical use only. Use only as directed by a recommending medical provider."; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(v)(C): for a container labeled on or after January 1, 2024, "WARNING: Cannabis has intoxicating effects, may be addictive, and may increase risk of mental illness. Do not operate a vehicle or machinery under its influence. KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN. This product is for medical use only. Use only as directed by a recommending medical provider."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(vi): for raw cannabis or a cannabis product sold in a vaporizer cartridge labeled on or after May 3, 2023, includes a warning label that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(vi)(A): "WARNING: Vaping of cannabis-derived products has been associated with lung injury."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(1)(b)(vi)(B): "WARNING: Inhalation of cannabis smoke has been associated with lung injury.".
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(2): To ensure that a cannabis product that a cannabis processing facility processes or produces has a medical rather than recreational disposition, the facility may not produce or process a product whose logo, product name, or brand name includes terms related to recreational marijuana, including "weed," "pot," "reefer," "grass," "hash," "ganja," "Mary Jane," "high," "haze," "stoned," "joint," "bud," "smoke," "euphoria," "dank," "doobie," "kush," "frost," "cookies," "rec," "bake," "blunt," "combust," "bong," "budtender," "dab," "blaze," "toke," or "420."
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(3): For any cannabis or cannabis product that the cannabis processing facility processes into a gelatinous cube, gelatinous rectangular cuboid, or lozenge in a cube or rectangular cuboid shape, the facility shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(3)(a): ensure that the label described in Subsection (1)(a) does not contain a photograph or other image of the content of the container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(3)(b): include on the label described in Subsection (1)(a) a warning about the risks of over-consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(4): For any cannabis product that contains an artificially derived cannabinoid, the cannabis processing facility shall ensure that the label clearly:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(4)(a): identifies each artificially derived cannabinoid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(4)(b): identifies that each artificially derived cannabinoid is an artificially derived cannabinoid.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5): In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5)(a): shall make rules to establish:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5)(a)(i): a standard labeling format that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5)(a)(i)(A): complies with the requirements of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5)(a)(i)(B): ensures inclusion of a pharmacy label; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5)(a)(ii): additional requirements on packaging for cannabis and cannabis products to ensure safety and product quality; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-602(5)(b): may make rules to further define standards regarding images, words, phrases, or containers that may appeal to children under Subsection (1)(a)(v) or (1)(b)(ii).


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603 Cannabis product -- Product quality.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1): (1)(a)(iii) A cannabis processing facility:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1)(a): may not produce a cannabis product in a physical form that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1)(a)(i): the facility knows or should know appeals to children;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1)(a)(ii): is designed to mimic or could be mistaken for a candy product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1)(a)(iii): for a cannabis product used in vaporization, includes a candy-like flavor or another flavor that the facility knows or should know appeals to children;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1)(b): (1)(a)(iii) notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(1)(c): shall ensure that batch heavy metal testing is conducted on any vaporizer cartridge that is used with a cannabis product.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(2): A cannabis product may vary in the cannabis product's labeled cannabinoid profile by up to 10% of the indicated amount of a given cannabinoid, by weight.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(3): A cannabis processing facility shall isolate any artificially derived cannabinoid to a purity of greater than 95%, as determined by an independent cannabis testing laboratory using liquid chromatography-mass spectroscopy or an equivalent method.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (1)(a) The department shall make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(4)(a): adopt human safety standards for the manufacturing of cannabis products that are consistent with best practices for the use of cannabis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(4)(b): (1)(a) further define standards regarding products that may appeal to children under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-603(5): (1)(a); (4)(b) Nothing in this section prohibits a sugar coating on a gelatinous cube, gelatinous rectangular cuboid, or lozenge to mask the product's taste, subject to the limitations on form and appearance described in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-604 Advertising.
--------------------------------------------
In accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the department may make rules establishing conditions under which a cannabis processing facility may engage in targeted marketing.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(3)(a)(ii): transfer cannabis or a cannabis product to a medical cannabis pharmacy until an independent cannabis testing laboratory tests a representative sample of the cannabis or cannabis product in accordance with department rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(3)(b): A medical cannabis pharmacy may not offer any cannabis or cannabis product for sale unless an independent cannabis testing laboratory has tested a representative sample of the cannabis or cannabis product in accordance with department rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(4): (4)(b) Before the sale of a cannabis product, an independent cannabis testing laboratory shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(4)(b)(i): raw cannabis; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(4)(b)(ii): a cannabis product:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(4)(b)(ii)(A): contained in a vaporizer cartridge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(4)(b)(ii)(B): in concentrate form; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(4)(c): (4)(b) record the five highest terpene profiles tested under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The department shall establish by rule, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-701(6): The department may require an independent cannabis testing laboratory to participate in a proficiency evaluation that the department conducts or that an organization that the department approves conducts.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-902 Cannabis production establishment product for academic research.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A cannabis production establishment may sell cannabis and cannabis products to a medical cannabis research licensee for the purpose of academic research.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-903 Unlawful acts.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-903(1): It is unlawful for a person who is not operating under the license of a medical cannabis research licensee to obtain or possess cannabis for academic medical cannabis research.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-903(2): It is unlawful for a cannabis production establishment to offer, sell, or otherwise provide cannabis or cannabis products for the purpose of academic research to an entity that is not a medical cannabis research licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-903(3): The department may seize from a medical cannabis research licensee and destroy cannabis or cannabis products that do not comply with this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001 Medical cannabis pharmacy -- License -- Eligibility.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(1): A person may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(1)(a): operate as a medical cannabis pharmacy without a license that the department issues under this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(1)(b): obtain a medical cannabis pharmacy license if obtaining the license would cause the person to exceed the pharmacy ownership limit;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(1)(c): obtain a partial ownership share of a medical cannabis pharmacy if obtaining the partial ownership share would cause the person to exceed the pharmacy ownership limit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(1)(d): enter into any contract or agreement that allows the person to directly or indirectly control the operations of a medical cannabis pharmacy if the person's control of the medical cannabis pharmacy would cause the person to effectively exceed the pharmacy ownership limit.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2): 4-41a-1005; 4-41a-201.1; 4-41a-1004; 4-41a-1106; 4-41a-104; 63J-1-504

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c)(i): A person may not locate a medical cannabis pharmacy:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c)(i)(A): within 200 feet of a community location; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c)(i)(B): in or within 600 feet of a district that the relevant municipality or county has zoned as primarily residential.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c)(ii): The proximity requirements described in Subsection (2)(c)(i) shall be measured from the nearest entrance to the medical cannabis pharmacy establishment by following the shortest route of ordinary pedestrian travel to the property boundary of the community location or residential area.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c)(iii): The department may grant a waiver to reduce the proximity requirements in Subsection (2)(c)(i) by up to 20% if the department determines that it is not reasonably feasible for the applicant to cite the proposed medical cannabis pharmacy without the waiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1001(2)(c)(iv): An applicant for a license under this section shall provide evidence of compliance with the proximity requirements described in Subsection (2)(c)(i).

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004 Operating plan.
------------------------------------------------
A person applying for a medical cannabis pharmacy license shall submit to the department a proposed operation plan for the medical cannabis pharmacy that includes:Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(1): a description of the physical characteristics of the proposed facility, including a floor plan and an architectural elevation;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(2): a description of the credentials and experience of:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(2)(a): each officer, director, or owner of the proposed medical cannabis pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(2)(b): any highly skilled or experienced prospective employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(3): the medical cannabis pharmacy's employee training standards;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(4): a security plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(5): a description of the medical cannabis pharmacy's inventory control system, including a plan to make the inventory control system compatible with the state electronic verification system;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(6): storage protocols, both short- and long-term, to ensure that cannabis is stored in a manner that is sanitary and preserves the integrity of the cannabis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(7): a description of the proposed medical cannabis pharmacy's strategic plan for opening the medical cannabis pharmacy, including gauging appropriate timing based on:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(7)(a): the supply of medical cannabis and medical cannabis products, in consultation with the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1004(7)(b): the quantity and condition of the population of medical cannabis cardholders, in consultation with the Department of Health and Human Services.


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005 Maximum number of licenses.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (1)(b) or (d), if a sufficient number of applicants apply, the department shall issue up to 15 medical cannabis pharmacy licenses in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(b): If an insufficient number of qualified applicants apply for the available number of medical cannabis pharmacy licenses, the department shall issue a medical cannabis pharmacy license to each qualified applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c): The department may issue the licenses described in Subsection (1)(a) in accordance with this Subsection (1)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c)(i): Using one procurement process, the department may issue eight licenses to an initial group of medical cannabis pharmacies and six licenses to a second group of medical cannabis pharmacies.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c)(ii): The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c)(ii)(A): divide the state into no less than four geographic regions, set by the department in rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c)(ii)(B): issue at least one license in each geographic region during each phase of issuing licenses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c)(ii)(C): complete the process of issuing medical cannabis pharmacy licenses no later than July 1, 2020.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(c)(iii): In issuing a 15th license under Subsection (1), the department shall ensure that the license recipient will locate the medical cannabis pharmacy within Dagget, Duchesne, Uintah, Carbon, Sevier, Emery, Grand, or San Juan County.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(d)(i): The department may issue licenses to operate a medical cannabis pharmacy in addition to the licenses described in Subsection (1)(a) if the department determines, in consultation with the Department of Health and Human Services and after an annual or more frequent analysis of the current and anticipated market for medical cannabis, that each additional license is necessary to provide an adequate supply, quality, or variety of medical cannabis to medical cannabis cardholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(d)(ii): The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(d)(ii)(A): in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, make rules to establish criteria and processes for the consultation, analysis, and application for a license described in Subsection (1)(d)(i); and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(1)(d)(ii)(B): report to the Executive Appropriations Committee of the Legislature before each time the department issues an additional license under Subsection (1)(d)(i) regarding the results of the consultation and analysis described in Subsection (1)(d)(i) and the application of the criteria described in Subsection (1)(d)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2): 4-41a-1004; 4-41a-108; 4-41a-108
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a): 4-41a-1004 If there are more qualified applicants than there are available licenses for medical cannabis pharmacies, the department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i): 4-41a-1004 evaluate each applicant and award the license to the applicant that best demonstrates:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i)(A): experience with establishing and successfully operating a business that involves complying with a regulatory environment, tracking inventory, and training, evaluating, and monitoring employees;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i)(B): an operating plan that will best ensure the safety and security of patrons and the community;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i)(C): positive connections to the local community;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i)(D): the suitability of the proposed location and the location's accessibility for qualifying patients;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i)(E): the extent to which the applicant can increase efficiency and reduce the cost of medical cannabis for patients; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(i)(F): 4-41a-1004 a strategic plan described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(a)(ii): ensure a geographic dispersal among licensees that is sufficient to reasonably maximize access to the largest number of medical cannabis cardholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(b): 4-41a-108; 4-41a-108 In making the evaluation described in Subsection (2)(a), the department may give increased consideration to applicants who indicate a willingness to:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(b)(i): operate as a home delivery medical cannabis pharmacy that accepts electronic medical cannabis orders that the state central patient portal facilitates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(b)(ii): 4-41a-108; 4-41a-108 accept payments through:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(b)(ii)(A): 4-41a-108 a payment provider that the Division of Finance approves, in consultation with the state treasurer, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(2)(b)(ii)(B): 4-41a-108 a financial institution in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1005(3): The department may conduct a face-to-face interview with an applicant for a license that the department evaluates under Subsection (2).


Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101 Operating requirements -- General.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(1): 4-41a-1001; 4-41a-1001; 4-41a-1004

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(1)(a)(i): 4-41a-1001 at the physical address provided to the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(1)(a)(ii): 4-41a-1001; 4-41a-1004 in accordance with the operating plan provided to the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(1)(b): A medical cannabis pharmacy shall notify the department before a change in the medical cannabis pharmacy's physical address or operating plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2): 80-7-105; 4-41a-1103 An individual may not enter a medical cannabis pharmacy unless the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(a): 80-7-105 is at least 18 years old or is an emancipated minor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b): 4-41a-1103 except as provided in Subsection (4):
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b)(i): possesses a valid:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b)(i)(A): medical cannabis pharmacy agent registration card;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b)(i)(B): pharmacy medical provider registration card; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b)(i)(C): medical cannabis card;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b)(ii): 4-41a-1103 is an employee of the department performing an inspection under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(2)(b)(iii): is another individual as the department provides.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(3): A medical cannabis pharmacy may not employ an individual who is younger than 21 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(4): Notwithstanding Subsection (2)(a), a medical cannabis pharmacy may authorize an individual who is not a medical cannabis pharmacy agent or pharmacy medical provider to access the medical cannabis pharmacy if the medical cannabis pharmacy tracks and monitors the individual at all times while the individual is at the medical cannabis pharmacy and maintains a record of the individual's access.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(5): A medical cannabis pharmacy shall operate in a facility that has:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(5)(a): a single, secure public entrance;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(5)(b): a security system with a backup power source that:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(5)(b)(i): detects and records entry into the medical cannabis pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(5)(b)(ii): provides notice of an unauthorized entry to law enforcement when the medical cannabis pharmacy is closed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(5)(c): a lock on each area where the medical cannabis pharmacy stores cannabis or a cannabis product.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(6): 4-41a-1102 A medical cannabis pharmacy shall post, both clearly and conspicuously in the medical cannabis pharmacy, the limit on the purchase of cannabis described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(7): 26B-4-213 Except for an emergency situation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(8): A medical cannabis pharmacy may not sell cannabis or a cannabis product without first indicating on the cannabis or cannabis product label the name of the medical cannabis pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(a): Each medical cannabis pharmacy shall retain in the pharmacy's records the following information regarding each recommendation underlying a transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(a)(i): the recommending medical provider's name, address, and telephone number;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(a)(ii): the patient's name and address;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(a)(iii): the date of issuance;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(a)(iv): directions of use and dosing guidelines or an indication that the recommending medical provider did not recommend specific directions of use or dosing guidelines; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(a)(v): if the patient did not complete the transaction, the name of the medical cannabis cardholder who completed the transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (9)(b)(iii), a medical cannabis pharmacy may not sell medical cannabis unless the medical cannabis has a label securely affixed to the container indicating the following minimum information:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(A): the name, address, and telephone number of the medical cannabis pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(B): the unique identification number that the medical cannabis pharmacy assigns;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(C): the date of the sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(D): the name of the patient;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(E): the name of the recommending medical provider who recommended the medical cannabis treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(F): directions for use and cautionary statements, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(G): the amount dispensed and the cannabinoid content;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(H): the suggested use date;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(I): for unprocessed cannabis flower, the legal use termination date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(i)(J): any other requirements that the department determines, in consultation with the Division of Professional Licensing and the Board of Pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(ii): A medical cannabis pharmacy is exempt from the requirement to provide the following information under Subsection (9)(b)(i) if the information is already provided on the product label that a cannabis production establishment affixes:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(ii)(A): a unique identification number;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(ii)(B): directions for use and cautionary statements;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(ii)(C): amount and cannabinoid content; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(ii)(D): a suggested use date.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(iii): If the size of a medical cannabis container does not allow sufficient space to include the labeling requirements described in Subsection (9)(b)(i), the medical cannabis pharmacy may provide the following information described in Subsection (9)(b)(i) on a supplemental label attached to the container or an informational enclosure that accompanies the container:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(iii)(A): the cannabinoid content;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(iii)(B): the suggested use date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(iii)(C): any other requirements that the department determines.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(9)(b)(iv): A medical cannabis pharmacy may sell medical cannabis to another medical cannabis pharmacy without a label described in Subsection (9)(b)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(10): 26B-4-204; 26B-4-213; 26B-4-231 A pharmacy medical provider or medical cannabis pharmacy agent shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(10)(a): 26B-4-204 upon receipt of an order from a limited medical provider in accordance with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(10)(a)(i): for a written order or an electronic order under circumstances that the department determines, contact the limited medical provider or the limited medical provider's office to verify the validity of the recommendation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(10)(a)(ii): for an order that the pharmacy medical provider or medical cannabis pharmacy agent verifies under Subsection (10)(a)(i) or an electronic order that is not subject to verification under Subsection (10)(a)(i), enter the limited medical provider's recommendation or renewal, including any associated directions of use, dosing guidelines, or caregiver indication, in the state electronic verification system;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(10)(b): 26B-4-213 in processing an order for a holder of a conditional medical cannabis card described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(a): A medical cannabis pharmacy may create a medical cannabis disposal program that allows an individual to deposit unused or excess medical cannabis or cannabis residue from a medical cannabis device in a locked box or other secure receptacle within the medical cannabis pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(b): A medical cannabis pharmacy with a disposal program described in Subsection (11)(a) shall ensure that only a medical cannabis pharmacy agent or pharmacy medical provider can access deposited medical cannabis.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c): A medical cannabis pharmacy shall dispose of any deposited medical cannabis by:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c)(i): rendering the deposited medical cannabis unusable and unrecognizable before transporting deposited medical cannabis from the medical cannabis pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c)(ii): disposing of the deposited medical cannabis in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c)(ii)(A): federal and state law, rules, and regulations related to hazardous waste;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c)(ii)(B): the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, 42 U.S.C. Sec. 6991 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c)(ii)(C): Title 19, Chapter 6, Part 5, Solid Waste Management Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(11)(c)(ii)(D): other regulations that the department makes in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(12): A medical cannabis pharmacy:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(12)(a): shall employ a pharmacist who is licensed under Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act, as a pharmacy medical provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(12)(b): may employ a physician who has the authority to write a prescription and is licensed under Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act, or Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act, as a pharmacy medical provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(12)(c): shall ensure that a pharmacy medical provider described in Subsection (12)(a) works onsite during all business hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(12)(d): shall designate one pharmacy medical provider described in Subsection (12)(a) as the pharmacist-in-charge to oversee the operation of and generally supervise the medical cannabis pharmacy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(12)(e): shall allow the pharmacist-in-charge to determine which cannabis and cannabis products the medical cannabis pharmacy maintains in the medical cannabis pharmacy's inventory.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1101(13): The department shall establish by rule, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, protocols for a recall of cannabis and cannabis products by a medical cannabis pharmacy.

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106 Medical cannabis pharmacy agent -- Registration.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(1): An individual may not serve as a medical cannabis pharmacy agent of a medical cannabis pharmacy unless the department registers the individual as a medical cannabis pharmacy agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(2): A recommending medical provider may not act as a medical cannabis pharmacy agent, have a financial or voting interest of 2% or greater in a medical cannabis pharmacy, or have the power to direct or cause the management or control of a medical cannabis pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3): 4-41a-104; 63J-1-504; 53-10-108; 63J-1-504
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(a): 4-41a-104; 63J-1-504 The department shall, within 15 days after the day on which the department receives a complete application from a medical cannabis pharmacy on behalf of a prospective medical cannabis pharmacy agent, register and issue a medical cannabis pharmacy agent registration card to the prospective agent if the medical cannabis pharmacy:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(a)(i): provides to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(a)(i)(A): the prospective agent's name and address;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(a)(i)(B): the name and location of the licensed medical cannabis pharmacy where the prospective agent seeks to act as the medical cannabis pharmacy agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(a)(i)(C): the submission required under Subsection (3)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(a)(ii): 4-41a-104; 63J-1-504 pays a fee to the department in an amount that, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b): 53-10-108 Each prospective agent described in Subsection (3)(a) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b)(i): 53-10-108 submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b)(i)(A): a fingerprint card in a form acceptable to the Department of Public Safety; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b)(i)(B): 53-10-108 a signed waiver in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b)(ii): consent to a fingerprint background check by:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b)(ii)(A): the Bureau of Criminal Identification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(b)(ii)(B): the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(c): The Bureau of Criminal Identification shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(c)(i): check the fingerprints the prospective agent submits under Subsection (3)(b) against the applicable state, regional, and national criminal records databases, including the Federal Bureau of Investigation Next Generation Identification System;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(c)(ii): report the results of the background check to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(c)(iii): maintain a separate file of fingerprints that prospective agents submit under Subsection (3)(b) for search by future submissions to the local and regional criminal records databases, including latent prints;
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(c)(iv): request that the fingerprints be retained in the Federal Bureau of Investigation Next Generation Identification System's Rap Back Service for search by future submissions to national criminal records databases, including the Next Generation Identification System and latent prints; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(c)(v): establish a privacy risk mitigation strategy to ensure that the department only receives notifications for an individual with whom the department maintains an authorizing relationship.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(d): 63J-1-504 The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(d)(i): 63J-1-504 assess an individual who submits fingerprints under Subsection (3)(b) a fee in an amount that the department sets in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(3)(d)(ii): remit the fee described in Subsection (3)(d)(i) to the Bureau of Criminal Identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(4): The department shall designate, on an individual's medical cannabis pharmacy agent registration card the name of the medical cannabis pharmacy where the individual is registered as an agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(5): A medical cannabis pharmacy agent shall comply with a certification standard that the department develops in collaboration with the Division of Professional Licensing and the Board of Pharmacy, or a third-party certification standard that the department designates by rule, in collaboration with the Division of Professional Licensing and the Board of Pharmacy and in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(6): The department shall ensure that the certification standard described in Subsection (5) includes training in:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(6)(a): Utah medical cannabis law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(6)(b): medical cannabis pharmacy best practices.
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(7): The department may revoke the medical cannabis pharmacy agent registration card of, or refuse to issue a medical cannabis pharmacy agent registration card to, an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(7)(a): violates the requirements of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(7)(b): is convicted under state or federal law of:

Utah Code Annotated § 4-41a-1106(7)(b)(ii): after December 3, 2018, a misdemeanor for drug distribution.
